intro: Glossarrhen mexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. Glossarrhen mexicanus is also known for its ability to produce a sticky, resinous substance from its leaves.
